review: Excellent meal~ excellent service, the Dumplings were fantastic and they have the Best Shrimp in the World.

Flaky service/flaky servers. It was 4th of July and no place else was open. I hadn't eaten for days (poorly planned fast). I get here just before 10 and this place is a ghost town.  Takes a few minutes before we are seated, then server disappears after giving drink orders. I was ready to place full order but Speedy was not in the mood to stick around after I said, "water with lemon."  As we wait for our drinks we notice on the other side of the bar - our same server taking another tables order - but they were seated after us. This gets us piss until we take notice that since we've entered no other servers ever appeared. Almost every time we come we get pissed off looking servers and I'm thinking it's because of the lack of help. Food was nothing to rave about - but it's cheap eats when you want to sit back and watch a game. We were just happy it was warm when it finally arrived.  Worst thing server could have done was given us the check and never came back. Didn't ask if we wanted dessert or if we needed to go boxes. After two commercial breaks - we were done.

Absolutely horrible service, took 20 minutes to get drinks, steaks came before the queso and the waitress was pissed because we were not happy.   Do yourself a favor and pick ANY of the other restaurants in Southside.
Always a good time in their bar. Two-for-one specials are great for a fun night close to home.

TGI Fridays is one of those restaurants/bars where you just can't go wrong! I remember when we would go to our local TGI Fridays in New Jersey when we were kids on a weekly basis, everything about the place says come in and have a good time, from the sports bar, the t.v.'s at the booths that you and your kids can watch while dining, or just knowing that they will always have something that's good to eat! With all that said I love how they've added the new appetizers, like the spicy ahi tuna crisps...so good, and the bruschetta is amazing!! They also have an extensively long cocktail list, and my favorite go to item for years on there menu has been there potato skins, with extra sour cream. The staff at Fridays is always so friendly and the service is great!
I've been here on several occasions.  I've always had good food at a good price with great service.  Surprisingly, they never seem to be crowded at this location.  Loving the rewards program.

This seems to be a trend at Fridays. Great food terrible service. I ask friends they say the same thing . Ate at the bar, My wife and I were there about 10 minutes . bartender had back to us and the bar was empty. Finally turned around after he was eating his dinner and served us. That being said he was excellent from that point forward. And food was great and beer was cold. Typical Fridays.

I visited my local TGI Friday's recently because a group of friends and I were interested in the restaurant's new unlimited appetitizers promotion. When we got there, well, let's just say there are some things that the commercial should have mentioned before leading people on. First and foremost, if you order the unlimited apps, the waiter is told not to bring you a second round unless you have completely finished your first set. Second, you cannot change apps: if you ordered the boneless with parmesan garlic, that's what you will get all night. You can't even change the sauce to buffalo; it has to be parmesan garlic all night. Finally, you are not allowed to take your apps home with you. Before I forget, I just want to mention that when reviewing the additional tips for TGI Friday's, Yelp asks what days are best to visit this restaurant and, ironically, the popular days people have selected are Saturday and Sunday - not Friday. But overall, the service at TGI Friday's throughout Jacksonville is spotty at best unless you're at the bar.

I didn't have a "bad" experience here, but it wasn't a good one, either.  Food was okay, service was haphazard and slow, and we just were not impressed.  I kinda wish I had spent a little extra money and gone to the Ale House next door.

Great place to go to watch your favorite team's sporting events,  lots of TV's and some booths have a small TV right there. Lots of booths and tables, a large bar, huge list of apps and starters, typical pub fare with some interesting grilled items, steaks and delicious burgers, quite a few desserts and good drink specials. 2 for 1 margaritas & mojitos, $10 per person endless apps (several choices available for that special). Very convenient location in the Tinseltown area, near the movie theater. Open late 7 days a week.

About what you would expect from a chain restaurant. The service was good, the food was OK. Ironically I wasn't that hungry, so I didn't get their all you can eat appetizer for $10. My single plate ended up costing me $11!!!

We came here to eat but we were not all that hungry. The waitress was very nice. We needed up ordering two appetizers one of the 3-for-1 and one with shrimp,chicken and ribs. They were all very good the only reason I gave this place 4 stars is because the chicken had a piece of hair on it, yes the waitress did return it and get me a new one but the fact that, that happened, it's just something disgusting that should of never happened

A good place to catch a quick meal, a lot quieter than I thought it would be. My wife had the Beer Cheese Burger and she said it was very good. I had the Bruschetta  Shrimp Pasta and it was excellent. The service was good but not great. just adequate.

Before heading to dinner at TGI Friday's for a friend's birthday the other night we all talked about how we hadn't been to a TGI Friday's in a long time. After this experience it'll be quite a while before I go back. We arrived right at 5pm on a Saturday and I was surprised how full the parking lot was. We walked up to the hostess station and there seemed to be some confusion or issue (maybe that should have tipped us off). One of the hostesses was taking people who had walked in just before us to a table while a second apologized probably 3 times and told us "someone would be right be with us" (we were only standing there for a few minutes total). When the first hostess came back, the second told her (as she walked us to towards the table) that the chart needed to be fixed (as I said, lots of confusion). We were seated near the bar and given menus. We started to look at our menus and all three of us had picked out our entire meals but a waiter had yet to even stop at our table. I got up and went up to the hostess station to make sure someone knew we were there. As I was walking that way, our waiter finally showed up. Apparently he asked my friends if i'd told them what i wanted before i walked away. Like, really? When I walked back to the table, his "apology" was "Yeah, I know, there are only two of us here tonight." So...okay, then. We all ordered and when I ordered a drink rather than saying "hey, can I see your id?" he said "if you guys are going to order drinks, I need ids" like we were a bunch of idiots who should have thrown our ids at him (we're all in our late 20s). He acted like we were bothering him every time he came over (which wasn't often). Maybe everyone there was having a bad day but it was just a constant attitude, which was frustrating. The food was fine, though the menu was a little confusing. We had looked up the menu online prior to arriving and I saw their current promotion that includes a handful of food and drink combinations for $10. The only place at the table this was listed was in the little drink book and the names of the included meals on the menu were different from the ones online for the same food (the promotion materials called what I ordered "sizzling citrus herb chicken" while the regular menu called the same meal "sizzling chicken and spinach.") That might be nit-picking but it struck me as odd. The chicken itself was okay, it was basically a plain grilled chicken breast with a sauce laid on top (I scraped most of the sauce off). It was served over spinach with a couple of mushrooms, a few slices of squash, and a pretty good sized tomato and mozzarella salad. I also got the light cosmo cooler, which was really good. The tomato/mozzarella salad and the drink were easily the best parts of the meal. The food was certainly not worth the production it took to get it. With so many superior options within a few minutes of this restaurant, I don't understand how they can run the place like this. Not impressed.

Four star for a Fridays?! James, are you drunk?! Yes. Don't go here for the food. It sucks. It's worse than other chain places I've been to. However, go here for the bar. It's a huge horseshoe bar with tons of surrounding booths. The bartenders are friendly and the drink prices are OK. A good alternative to the Alehouse and Tinseltown bars. Sometimes I like just sitting at the bar and watching the game, you're bound to meet someone here. Come on.. it's a freaking FRIDAYS!

I enjoy the pecan-crusted chicken salad each time I visit. The food is not horrible but not the greatest either. Service has been friendly each time I've been in, no problems there. Always loud but that's to be expected. Best deals are on week nights and Sunday's, as far as appetizers and drinks specials go. A visit to this place is really only worth it if you can't get the meal elsewhere and if you're a stripes member. Mention being a stripes member and you get free chips and salsa.

I sat in the bar area with my wife and watched for 30 mins as everyone else got served. Then we walked out. It's these times where as a black man , I feel like no one wanted to serve us because they think we might not tip.

The worst Friday's I have ever been to. They should just close this one down. As long time Friday's patrons this is the worst location I have ever been to. If I could give it less than 1 star I would as it does not even deserve the one.  The service was beyond slow. We ordered apps and we told the waitress that was was for my and my husband was having the never ending and she proceeding in lecturing us that we could not share and that we would get in trouble and blah blah blah. Im not a child... I do not need a lecture. Cocktails were two for one but being the responsible driving I chose a soft drink. It had no fizz at all. The glass was all wet like it had been sitting on the counter filled aged ago and I was not offered a straw. My husband ordered beer and both came at the same time so he had to chug one straight down to so the other would not be cold. I understand the two for one concept but what a way to give a person a fast buzz when they do not want one. We waited and waited for our apps and then the waitress said she was taking our menus. Gee we didnt have the option of ordering dinner. So we told her we wanted dinner. Everything took forever. When the apps came they were cold. They had been sitting too. As I said before we are frequent Friday's guests so I know what it should taste like and the way it should be presented. As soon as the apps arrived our cold burgers arrived as well. Jack Danial's burgers are always our favorite and these were GROSS !!!! that is the best thing i can say about all of the food. To finally get of out check was like pulling teeth and then paying was even longer. The waitress was mad that we had points to pay for our dinners. Gee.... we are good customers at OTHER locations and deserve our points. Sadly we wasted them at this location. It will NEVER happen again. AVOID at all costs !!!

My Cousin his lady Myself and my fiance came here for drinks and we had a blast. Walked into the Saturday drink special ( 2 for 1) took in the NCAA tourney game and talked. Will be back whenever we are on the Southside.

Typical Friday's. Bartender (the lady) was awesome and friendly. The guy took about 10 minutes to even acknowledge me sitting at the bar despite sitting down right in front of him. Food was okay. The bar itself is HUGE (giant horseshoe shaped).
To go order was horrible! Loaded potato skins were a joke thrown together and the tostada nachos were soggy-nasty and nothing nacho about it.

TERRIBLE service!  We will never go back.  We were seated right away...ok great.  The restaurant was nearly empty so we figured we would have great service...WRONG!  We waited about 10 minutes with no one coming to our table. My family and I finally walked out.  Never again!
I waited 10 minutes at the bar for anyone to even notice I was there- two bartenders behind the bar part of the time, and in order to get noticed I had to physically get up and move. Not impressive.

3 stars the food actually got better. I was disappointed in the service the waiter we had was nice and he was trying his hardest.  It wasn't his fault I  think for Friday night they got busier than they expected. I think he was only one of like 3 servers for the whole restaurant tonight.  Took a while to get drinks maybe 15 20 minutes. We ordered a glass of red wine we got white. The food took forever to come out maybe 30 minutes. I ordered a basket of fries that didn't come out until the end of dinner.  We waited another 20 minutes or so for desert. I think Friday's was overwhelmed and understaffed.

Went with a friend and we decided to sit at the bar. Our bartender had attitude, but in a good way. She was keeping an eye on us because there was a guy who was trying to creep on us.  Anyway, atmosphere was very energized. My long islands were very strong. (It was bogo certain drinks which was awesome) I only ordered the fried green beans appetizer. So good! All in all good experience.
Friday's is always a classic. It's my go-to when not sure where to go for food and drinks. Good drink specials and food. Pot stickers and ribs are usually what I get. Along with some LI Tea's...
It is a shame , the wine bottle was opened before to come to my table. I do not accepted it. I was required and paid for that. I never take it.  G. Teran Rph. 786-2712612

Where is Jonathan!!!!!!????  This place has gone to hell....we arrived and literally waited for 10 mins and not ONE employee greeted us at all!  It was on yesterday which was Sunday football....they were not busy in the dining area. I was very pissed at the level disrespectful employees. This is my favorite restaurant, but...I won't be going back. That is unacceptable.  We finally left and went to the one on Atlantic and had an awesome experience.  Hey general manager, you need to do more training on customer service. #onehighlydisappointedcustomer
Miserable lunch experience. Wasn't busy, but took 90 minutes start to finish to receive the wrong order. Now I remember why I hadn't been in about 5 years.
Miss the 2 for 1 happy hour but they have added some drink specials. Love the give me more stripes program. Last visit was great. Jack Daniel's chicken and shrimp is yummo!

I came here with a friend when she received an email that endless apps where back. We brought both our families with us and had a wonderful night. Well as wonderful as you can with 3 kids under 4. Anyways we had a big booth that was able to fit all of us so I was happy about that. The endless appetizers was a great deal! Our server was a bit dense though. I don't think he kept up with us well. I know its a lot but seriously he asked me what I ordered twice and was always late with refills and food. We ordered chips as an appetizer first and they didn't come out till our food order come out.... seriously. when we have kids we need food like NOW! I wish there service was quicker. but the restaurant itself was nice and big! Clean and inviting. They had tavs in some booths. It would have been nice of us but I think our party was a little too big. Also we were seated right away and there wasn't much or a crowd.

We've been here twice. The first time I thought it was just an unlucky experience so I held off on my review. However, our second experience was just as bad as the first. The food is not the problem, what we received was good. But the first time we did not receive all of our food: our entree came on top of our appetizer and we never reviewed salads. Our waiter then tried to bring us salads after we were halfway through our entrees and we told him we did not want them at that point. Both times we never received drink refills even though we requested them. It also took much longer than it should have to receive our food. We will not return to this location.

TGI Friday's why do you make it so difficult to try to like you?  I came in last night before our movie at Tinseltown next door because I was craving a Jack Daniel's burger badly. Met our friend and were seated immediately. Our waitress came by got our drink order and so far we were off to a great start, but sadly that's where it ended. It took several minutes to get our drinks. Then it took another 20 minutes for our food. There were hardly any other occupied tables in the bar area where we sat too. When she came with our burgers she informed my friend that they had tomato on it even though he'd asked for it without. She then proceeded to say how the cook gave her grief over it in the back, but that she could bring it back if it was a big deal. It wasn't for him, so we moved on but man, it left a bad taste in our mouths (so to speak).  The food was good. Garlic Parmesan boneless wings appetizer was delicious, the burgers were good though a bit overcooked but fine too. Our second round of drinks came faster, but still took long enough for me to eat several fries and have a couple of bites of my burger.  My issue is that I want to love this place. I am just a really big fan of that Jack Daniel's sauce and the bottled stuff isn't nearly the same as what I get at the restaurant. I'd go to another location if there was one on this side of town but there just isn't. Please fix the issues with service as I know for a fact that I am not the only one who notices them.

Even though I love TGIF food and not a big fan of this location, staff needs some customer service training and it takes so long for them to bring your food, been there 3 times and each time I go have to wait 20-25 minutes to get our food.

Can you spell S......L....O......W? It was tough to take for a simple round of drinks after a fabulous dinner at the nearby Terra Gaucho. My table of 8 nearly walked out after waiting 30 minutes for the waitress and bartender to get our order of beers served....

Another one of those "wish I never went" dinners... First, wow! Slowest service I've ever experienced at a Friday's, ever. Actually, maybe any popular chain. Don't believe me? Read the other reviews. 20 minutes on apps and 30+ for entrees. Sad. Even the check took 15 minutes from asking for it to receiving my copy to sign. Second... It's like everyone there has a tude. Attitude for those who don't speak awesome. The host wasn't at the front when we walked in and 4 minutes later, shows up annoyed. Our server started off friendly, but as things started going wrong, so did her attitude. My wife said to the manager "this is why we don't come here" and he responds by walking away like he didn't work there. Unreal. The food... Oh wow. If they buy from Sysco, they are embarrassing Sysco. It's hard to make Sysco food taste that bad. It's an open the bag, fry or grill, then serve kinda thing. But they pulled it off. Cold, mushy, and obviously sitting under the heat lamp for far too long. Awful. Never again.

This place is slow. Slow service, slow food, slow drink refills. So sloooooooow.... With that being said I will admit that the best service we have had was from sitting at the bar. While food was still kinda slow the bartender was awesome. Anytime we have sat at a table a 45 minute dinner is almost 2 hours. Food is usually pretty decent but the slower the server the colder your food.  This place needs serious overhaul on staffing.
Decent chicken tenders and a large menu selection. Service was friendly but slow. Thats really all I have to say.

New owner growing pains , hosts playing at hosts desk didn't care about seating us very slow with very few customers , burger took 45 minutes burnt , dry and fries old , wilted toppings , must have sat in the window .Tea was muddy , had to carry the food back to the kitchen myself , they argued with me saying there was nothing wrong with the food , Lady manager wouldn't even talk to us she walked and shook her head no as she walked the opposite way. They didn't really care no one tried to stop us or apologize. The visit was 12-18-2016. Waitress tried but she couldn't do anything , we tipped her and left not eating plus we were hungry. Hard pressed to go back .
Ma daughters chicken sandwich was burn, I got the wrong food and literally we had to wait like one hour for our food, very disappointed we won't be back
If you are not hungry this is the place to go. I've been to this location twice and both times the service was very poor. There is no rush by the staff to take your order. Do not waste your time.

Thankfully the food is good... when you get it... if you get your order in right. Good grief!! We will not be back to this Fridays... sorry. Thankfully my child had a good dinner and she and my husband don't mind waiting for me to eat my forgotten cobb salad after they finished their dinner that I insisted they go ahead and eat while they grow lettuce for my salad. So complicated, huh? C'mon, Man!

Throughout my entire life, I have one memorable experience as the absolute worst restaurant experience.  That experience was about 15 years ago, at a Bennigan's in Sacramento, CA.  I'm sure Bennigan's would be elated to know that TGI Fridays has earned the most recent poor experience award and has a companion with TGI Fridays in this top spot of awfulness.  No longer does Bennigans sit at the top of the poo list as they had for over a decade and a half.   We visited this location on New Year's Eve to celebrate a birthday party with 8 people.  We were pleasantly surprised that the restaurant was less than 10% full, which in hindsight may have been the big red flag.   I tweeted about my experience and quickly received a reply, "We're sorry to hear that, Donald. Please email the details of your visit, the location, and your phone number to  ."  So, I take a substantial amount of time to compose an e-mail highlighting the many issues during our visit. What did Fridays do to earn this top spot of awful?   1. The service was slow and inattentive.  Again, the restaurant was less than 10% full. 2. The food was poor quality.  Dishes were not served as described on the menu and some things were horribly overcooked.  The bacon cheeseburger one person in our party ordered had no bacon.  The potato skins?  Well, one order had bacon and the other did not.  A request for a manger fell on deaf ears.  3. The drink pricing is simply out of line for a quick serve restaurant.  We were shocked at a charge of $23 for a double shot of well tequila.  A request for a manager fell on deaf ears. 4. The birthday girl ordered one of the shaker drinks.  It was good enough.  Her mom ordered one based on what was served and received easily 50% less drink.  Since she is a bartender, she asked to speak with the manager and instead the server came and took the drink to have it "remade" only to come back with the same drink with more ice put it the shaker.  Yet another request for a manager that fell on deaf ears. 5. There were other things that happened throughout our stay.  Menu items ordered were simply never served.  Drink refills were not offered and water was not refilled. 6.  We are not the folks that complain at every step of the way.  In fact, we have realistic expectations when choosing a quick serve chain restaurant.  But this list is not complete of the things that went wrong just for us.   I have been in the industry for many years.  I know that it is standard practice for a manager to visit a table when there are problems.  Never have I been refused a manager when I specifically asked for one, and truly who can say a manager refused to visit a table after 6 separate requests, and by several guests at a table. So, today I receive a call back today from "Arlene" in customer service about "my social media complaint."  I was asked to call her back and to ask for her.  I bite and call the 800 #.  It is some call center somewhere offshore.  Quickly it is obvious that English is a second language for these folks.  There was no attempt to transfer me to Arlene, but instead, as is the case with all these so called foreign customer service centers, the person that answers offers to help.  He pulls up something under my phone number and asks me to go through everything that happened again.  There is a clear communication barrier and I get sick of repeating myself 3 or more times for almost everything that I say.  I ask why some offshore call center is handling my complaint in which I asked to speak with a regional or district manager.  He says they are at the corporate office and they are above the regional/district management.  Is TGI Fridays corporate office located in the Philippines?  I end up losing patience and asking why my time is being wasted and if they expect this of all their customers who are trying to share a poor experience.  Eventually, after I pretty much lose it, I am told a regional manager will call me back at the number they have on file for me "in a few business days." I guess this is what I deserve for visiting TGI Fridays.  According to the customer service person, their corporate headquarters is located in the Philippines.  And even though I'm pretty confident this is not the case, this is what the customer service representative, who is higher up that district and regional managers, specifically told me. Fridays clearly doesn't value our business, and in this area there are dozens of far better dining options.  I'm surprised this place stays open...but I suspect they won't be open for much longer and will go the way of their closest competitor, Bennigan's. Some time after writing this review I was contacted by the Regional Director.  He said he was shocked about my experience at both the store and with their "corporate offices" in the Phillippines.  He offered gift certificates to ivnvite me to return.  Almost a month passed and I contacted the regional director again...still no cards...

So, went here for lunch with my coworkers and chose an outdoor seating due to the beautiful weather. It started out like any TGI Fridays experience where we were seated, served our drink orders, and ordered our meal. That's when the service went downhill, for me, at least. Everyone was served their lunch orders except me. I thought maybe the waitress just didn't have enough hands to grab all the food and will be right out with my order. It was when my colleagues were half way done with their meal was when I decided that they forgot my order. So I got up went inside and asked our waitress. She apologized and said she'll check on the order. 5 minutes later, still no food. So I went back inside. After waiting another couple of minutes, I got back up for the third time to ask. They finally came out with my sliders but missing the fries. I said fine but asked for side of mayo for my sliders. Again, nothing for a few minutes and I got up for the 4th time and told the waitress I asked for the mayo to eat with my sliders so it would be good for her to get it right away so I can finally start eating. Btw, still no fries. When I got all my food, the sliders were cold and all my coworkers were either done or close to being done with their meals. The zinger was when she finally apologized, it was to my coworkers, not to me and she blamed the kitchen staff for the delay. She never asked me how she can make up for my troubles, but did give my coworkers free deserts and waived their drinks, even though they all got their food on time. Btw, I didn't have any of the desert and had tap water to drink. So, no benefit to me at all.  This could be the worst TGI Friday's I've been to. I will say this, at no point was the waitress mean or disrespectful, just not very good at her job. That's my opinion, but my coworkers all loved her for bringing their food on time, giving them free deserts and waiving their drink orders. Tsk, tsk...

They have great specials for late night but their servers and bartenders at night suck id go to somewhere else in the area unless you want to be waiting 15 minutes for a beer. Won't be going back if tried it a couple times.

We just came out of the movie theater and it was late. Fridays was still open till 2am so we stopped there to grab a bite. While it was a weeknight and mostly a few couples eating at the booths around the bar I didn't expect service to be so slow. It took a while for us to get both our drinks and our food. Luckily the food made up for it. I ordered the Firecracker Sangria: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Fire, Malibu Coconut, Seven Daughter Moscato, fresh sour, pineapple juice, blueberries and fresh strawberry. I've never had whiskey in a Sangria before and this was accurately described, fire, tropical, spicy, sweet, and refreshing. To eat I got the Sizzling Chicken and Spinach and a Tomato Mozzarella Salad. Healthy stuff to go with my drink hahaha. Everything was good and hit the spot. But while trying to wait out the storm that popped up all of a sudden I became snacky and ordered the Mozzarella Sticks. Diet extra ruined. These came out faster than anything else did tonight! Probably because they were just frozen and needed to be heated up. No magic but it killed the craving and bought enough time for the storm to pass. It's Fridays so it's just ok.
Eat here if you don't  want to receive your food or if you want your drinks to taste like water and food coloring. My best experience at this restaurant was leaving.

I ordered endless appetizers and now I know why they call them endless, because it takes forever and a day for them to get here. And you can only order one app at a time. Then you finish your first app in 5 minutes and you have to completely finish it then place another order with your waiter. The entire process makes endless app completely not worth it. My waitress even asked me if my girlfriend was having anything off my plate because she was going to have to charge me an extra $10. She didn't even eat anything off my plate.  I said,"so you're going to charge me $10 if she has one bite?" she said I'm just doing my job. Then I look over at the bar and I see people getting the shortest wine pours I've ever seen in any establishment. They're trying to save money by pouring little wine but in the end their losing money because you're not going to get a return customer. I would not pay for a drink at this restaurant because you're really only getting half of it. Girlfriend also ordered pink lemonade and it was like water and pink food coloring that tasted awful. I think our waitress goes on vacation after she puts down one of our weak meals too because I don't see her for 35 minutes. This place is empty and I can see why. This place just hands-down sucks. I've been here for an hour and a half and I've had two appetizers. You're also not allowed to take home your last appetizer either. I don't know what the hell they were thinking with this.

Was at first thankful Fridays is open late. Especially when the beau works until 12:30 am. Overall, there are other late night places I'd rather go to spend less, curb the post-work hunger, and relax. A: Don't get the sangria. 8 oz = $11.20 (what the heck?!) And no price on the menu. B: Endless apps are a good deal, not good enough to make me want to come back after the sangria. C: It's nice they're open late, but less so when the service is awful. You will likely feel rushed and is that even worth it?

TWO WORDS...DON'T GO..Dirty floors filthy with food strewn around small and big pieces. Unhygienic Servers. Not all but enough to make you want to run away and take your money with you..far away! Upon coming home only a long shower made me feel human again. Seriously the dirty booth (had to ask for it to be wiped down) still smelled like old oil or an area that didn't have ample circulation. The smell persisted during the whole meal. Dingy also...Food came I got chicken tenders that were over cooked and fries that didn't have salt on them. In most circumstances you could add your own salt but the ketchup bottles menus and salt and pepper shakers were filthy with food stuck to them.

Our server checked on us 1 time just to take our order. Thanks a whole lot for that and when someone else brought us our food it wasnt hot ... the manager came and gave us an apology and covered our check . The hostess was literally the sweetest person in the world . We tipped her and left . The stars are for her tho.

Very slow service, after one hour we got drinks then again 30 mins to get the main food.Appetizer is not yet come I think they do it purposefully to avoid unlimited appetizer deal .worst service ever , we order a flat bread and it was very soggy  ...Waiting time is too much .

This is probably the worst TGI Friday's I've ever ate at. Do yourself a favor drive an extra 10 mins down the road and go to the one by regency mall. There was a 20 minute wait because there are literally only 3 waiters in the whole restaurant. It took another 20 minutes to get our drink order, and about 45 extra minutes for our food. This isn't at night time either, we're talking about 1 PM in the middle of the day with maybe 9 tables seated in the whole restaurant. The chicken was over cooked and dry and the service is the absolutely worst I've ever had. If I could give this place no stars I would.

Rating this a 1 star is way more than enough. NEVER, EVER AGAIN. Dreadful, dreadful experience. When my wife and I first arrived there was no Hostess, we waited about 2-3 minutes and still gave TGI a chance. We should've went with our gut feeling. From my understanding, first impression should be a pleasant one, the hostess came up to us upset stating "How many... sit wherever". Not even a Hi or Hello.  Yet, we sit down got our waters... server came back about 2-3 minutes later, my wife ordered a soup. 14 Minutes went by (meanwhile hostess still is wandering around the restaurant not even keeping an eye on door, they lost about 2-3 customers) our server came back and stated, your soup will be out in 1 minute. 15 Minutes pass by she didn't come back or check on us and Soup still wasn't out. We flagged the hostess to get our server so we can see why the guy that came in way after us, sat at the bar, ordered and got his food and we still haven't got a Soup yet.. We waited about 5-9 minutes, the sever still didn't come to our table, maybe because how embarrassed she was.. We decided to leave and eat elsewhere.. If you want to save yourself a headache, do not come here!
Bun on my burger was hard as a rock. Service was terrible. I wasn't done eating and server brought me my check. Didn't even ask if I wanted another drink. Won't be back. Ever.

We've been to this TGI Friday's about 5 times. It's right around the corner and we get bogo meal coupons in the mail for it. If it hadn't been for the coupons, we wouldn't have gone back a 2nd time. We had leftover coupons and threw them away. We'll NEVER go back again. Every time we put in an order, there's something seriously wrong with it. The management must be horrible because being in the restaurant industry for years we know there's no other excuse for it. The last time we went was Friday night about 6 pm. We called in 2 identical orders with different sides.My husband waited an extra 10 minutes before picking up the to-go order since it's never been ready on time before. When he got there, the bartender handed him the bag. It felt light so he looked inside. They completely forgot my order! He told her and she apologized and put the order in. She said it would be 15 more minutes. He asked if they could make it quicker. He sat at the bar and ate his meal alone. When he brought my meal home, the chicken tasted like it had been microwaved. We're done giving this place a try. We like TGIF and will go to another one, just not this one.

We're just grabbing soup today so my review is based on things other than food. The bathroom towels aren't working and the ones on the counter are blocking the garbage. It's not bad just could improve on the accessibility. Also, I hate the bar chairs with a passion. They look thick and comfy but in reality your legs touch the metal bar, cutting off circulation while your butt sinks deep into the cushion. Most bar stools suck in my opinion though. It's quiet and the bartender is nice and I appreciate good conversation at a bar, even if it's brief while doing bar chores. I guess the experience is lackluster and it's not one bad thing, they could just be a more upbeat pleasant place considering the name inspires feeling of getting off work for the weekend. Maybe it was because we went mid week during the day.

So I came here last night, and every time I come here it get worse and worse. I'm a waitress so I understand how the floor works and I understand if you're busy. But there were barely any customers. And it was already 6-7 pm we were sat down, in the bar area and given menus. I usually rarely have a problem there. But I sat there for 20 minutes and not once did any waiter or waitress ask us anything our drinks or anything, I left the menu closed I had two waiters pass me ten times and I had two bartenders staring at us. No one wanted to serve or help us for 20 min. So I left and went to terra gucha. TGIF I used to love going there for dinner but Saturday it was horrible. You need a more attentive staff. Because no one cared.

This is the worst place and can I say the worst management. We went for my sons graduation and waited and hour and a half for food and normally I would say cool packed place right? Wrong half empty! We ordered the endless apps, waitress Mandy kept apologizing over and over. Manager came over said the reason it was taking so long ever thing needed to be fried. WHAT... Well not true do to us ordering flat bread and dumplings ?? Oh and salad ... Then when came time to pay the manager would not honor our military discount saying food was all ready discounted.. Really.
There was a hair in my food and I was disappointed in the portion sizes and that they didn't take more off the check than just the one dish with the hair.

This location is getting better. We had a newer server, Laura and she was wonderful. Tonight was a bartender contest and they had a DJ. Wasn't busy. We got our waters and appetizer (mozzarella sticks) right away. Our drinks took forever and bartender contest was on a break so don't know what happened there. Food took awhile to get out. I ordered the Jack Daniels chicken with broccoli and fries. Everything tasted great. My mom ordered Flat Iron steak with same sides. Really good steak, better than what their rib eyes have been. Overall the restaurant is turning around and that's making us happy. Last year we wouldn't even go because of how bad everything was.

Bacon  cheeseburger was good but can you really call it a bacon burger with 1 bacon??   Chicken and shrimp was cold and a little runny Grilled salmon was really good but the spinach was very soft and mushy Cajun chicken and shrimp Pasta was perfect.

Was just at this location and waited for 15 minutes for a server to come. I ended up going to the bar to ask if we could get a server, the bartender I spoke to was the rudest person I have ever spoken to in my entire life. After my confrontation with this rude employee, I walked out and will never return here again. Get it together TGI Friday's! Didn't expect this from your business.

Hope you have time to kill if you come here because it will take forever and a day before your server even appears. Then there was the agonizing, long wait to get our drinks - a margarita and a beer. We went with the endless appetizers and it took about 20 minutes for those to come out. I had the bacon nachos, which had about half a slice of bacon on them. Folks, I couldn't make this up if I tried. The amazing thing was that this place was at less than 50% capacity. So the excuse that they were slammed doesn't apply. Save yourself the headache and try somewhere else.

Save your time and money and go somewhere else. Sloooooooow service. Managers avoiding bailing staff out. Serving staff with excuse after excuse. Blaming managers, blaming kitchen staff. Short on bar glasses, plastic ramekins on plates. Every table around us complaining about food or service.

Very disappointed.   Went in to get endless apps which are very limited now on which ones.  Have watched the commercial countless times $10 endless apps!!!! Our bill came and waitress said that it had gone up to $12.99.   But they were very aware the commercials says $10.   Sorry.   Won't be back to this establishment.   $10 or $13.   Wasn't that good anyway.    Ask prices before you order....drinks were different than menu also.

Came in today at 2pm, only 6 other tables with people in the restaurant. It took about 10 minutes for our waiter to finally get to us. (There were 3 waiters working) For the restaurant not being busy it took quite some time for our food to come. The chips in the loaded bacon nachos were stale. The meatballs usually come with bread slices but didn't today. The chicken quesadilla didn't come with salsa. Our server never got us refills for our drinks until we were finished with all of our meals. Only gave this visit a 2 star because the food that did come was good.

This place is horrible. If you call ahead don't expect them to get your order right or take less then an hour to get you order. My husband called ahead they said it would take 15 mins. And hour later he's still waiting. Nobody would even acknowledge him. After waiting someone finally came over. They are out of the soup we ordered and also didn't even get it right. What a disaster. How do you stay in business like this? On top of it by the time we got our food. It was cold. What a wast of time and money. If you are looking for anything from this place you will be disappointed. You are better off going to a fast food place.

I am sitting here waiting on these folks to bring me my take out order. I called it in and they told me twenty minutes so I arrived at just that amount of time... only to sit for 10 minutes before the nice fellow behind the bar asked to take my order. I let him know I had a takeout order and now it's been another 10 waiting on him to come back. Apparently he's the only server in the whole place. I do see a manager type walking around that doesn't appear to be doing anything. This is ridiculous!

We walk in to TGIFridays tonight to have dinner with our friends and two other parties are waiting at the host station. We asked what was going on and they said that nobody was there and it had been about 5 minutes. Finally a young boy comes up and asks one of the parties how many they had and they said 5. He quickly ran off after telling them that he had to clean tables...ignoring us. The other party got mad and left. He came back and seated the party of 5. Now it's just us, he asks how many and we say 8 and a high chair. He ROLLs his eyes and walks away. Then, he came back and said it would be 20 minutes because they don't have any servers available (the restaurant was empty). We took our business elsewhere.

I don't even know if it's worth writing this review. I had a horrible experience here, the service was SLOW, the food took FOREVER and wasn't worth the wait.  I don't care for chain restaurants but seriously, it sucks to go somewhere, spend a decent amount of money and not to be satisfied with anything.  I will never come back to this location and honestly I want all of my money back!!!!

I couldn't even be bothered to put two stars on here. To start off with, our party had made a reservation however when we got there our tables weren't even out together. Literally it was as if our reservation didn't matter and was completely ignored by all staff. Secondly half of our party haven't arrived yet, so we waited patiently until they got there. But when we all ordered, food came out separately. Literally the people who were late got their food late and all sorts of drinks were mixed up. Had to ask for refills on drinks because the waitress didn't keep up with that. I had to wait for about a good 2 hours until my fiancé and I even got our food. My burger was decent but my fiancé had a very dry chicken and raw broccoli. Then we were told because of our bad service we would get 50 percent off on all of our orders but when we got our bills there wasn't even a discount on it. So we had to get the staff to redo all of our orders for the discount and even that took forever. This place needs a new make over. This place needs new management to be able to control everyone and everything. This place needs a serious make over otherwise this store will shut down. Shame that no ones doing anything about it.

Nice server, that's all that was good. The "BIG RIBS" were small, I've seen bigger RIBS on a cat. Lol. The salad was mediocre at best. The potstickers were slightly overcooked, the salad dressing was too thick. Will not be returning for a long time. Only good thing was the military discount, 15%. Best discount I have seen in Jacksonville for military.

Had the worst experience ever at TGIF!!!  Horrible service and the quality of food was also horrible.  Ordered the French onion soup which barely warm.  The cheese was NOT melted and the croutons were not toasted!  I also ordered the 2 for $10.  The onion rings came out with no sauce...menu states it comes out with several sauces.  By the time I got my sauce, the onion rings were cold.  Sliders came out about 10 minutes later.  Bartender did not give me silverware until I had to ask for it and for some reason she had to go to the back to get it!  I was never asked by the bartender or the manager if everything was ok.  The manager on duty talked to the people on my right on on my left as it appeared that they were regulars....I am not a regular, so I guess I am not worthy of their time.  Never received a refill on my drink because the bartender seemed to spend more time in the kitchen rather than the bar.  When I was leaving I was going to stop by the host stand to speak to someone about my experience and there was no one to be found!!!   TGIF....you need to get your act together.   Will not be back!
